page.title: 10THE PRINTING WORKS
page.content: Inchbrook Printers was started in 1946 although at that time it was called Abbey Press. Inchbrook's offices are in a building that is about 200 years old and used to be a pub called "The Dog and Badger". The company prints forms which customers have designed for their own use and are no good to anyone else. None of its products are sold in shops. 101 people are employed by the company. Most of them live in Kingswood or in the nearby villages. The workers have different working hours; some start early and finish early while others start and finish later. The factory employees do not require any special clothing but are provided with overalls if they wish.
